1:
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life,
\q Yahweh my God, you are very magnificent;
\q you are clothed with splendor and majesty.
\q
4:
He makes the winds his messengers,
\q flames of fire his servants.
\q
5:
He laid the foundations of the earth,
\q and it will never be moved.
7:
Your rebuke made the waters recede;
\q at the sound of your thunderous voice they fled.
8:
The mountains rose, and the valleys spread out
\q into the places that you had appointed for them.
\q
9:
You have set a boundary for them that they will not cross;
\q they will not cover the earth again.
12:
By the riverbanks the birds build their nests;
\q they sing among the branches.
13:
He waters the mountains from his water chambers in the sky.
\q The earth is filled with the fruit of his labor.
\q
14:
He makes the grass grow for the cattle
\q and plants for man to cultivate
\q so that man may produce food from the earth.
\q
15:
He makes wine to make man happy,
\q oil to make his face shine,
\q and food to sustain his life.
17:
There the birds make their nests.
\q The stork makes the cypress tree her home.
\q
18:
The wild goats live on the high mountains;
\q the mountain heights are a refuge for the hyraxes.
20:
You make the darkness of the night
\q when all the beasts of the forest come out.
21:
The young lions roar for their prey
\q and seek their food from God.
\q
22:
When the sun rises, they retreat
\q and sleep in their dens.
23:
Meanwhile, people go out to their work
\q and labor away until the evening.
\q
25:
Over there is the sea, deep and wide,
\q teeming with innumerable creatures,
\q both small and great.
\q
26:
The ships travel there,
\q and Leviathan is also there, which you formed to play in the sea.
27:
All these look to you to give them
\q their food on time.
\q
28:
When you give to them, they gather;
\q when you open your hand, they are satisfied.
29:
When you hide your face, they are troubled;
\q if you take away their breath, they die
\q and return to dust.
\q
30:
When you send out your Spirit, they are created,
\q and you renew the countryside.
32:
He looks down on the earth, and it shakes;
\q he touches the mountains, and they smoke.
34:
May my thoughts be sweet to him;
\q I will rejoice in Yahweh.
35:
May sinners vanish from the earth,
\q and let the wicked be no more.
\q I give praise to Yahweh with all my life.
\q Praise Yahweh.
